intro: Malache ovata, commonly known as the eggplant tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated for its foliage and floral display.
